selected_quotes: Tolerance of differences is a function of moral reasoning and behaviour Great article by Rivka …

citation.abstract: With vast numbers of people migrating around the world, understanding how racial tolerance is created – and encouraging more of it – is more important than ever.
citation.title: A refugee, like me: why the Golden Rule matters in an era of mass migration

facebook.title: A refugee, like me: why the Golden Rule matters in an era of mass migration
facebook.summary:
The Golden Rule - 
'A moral obligation to treat others well, is a representation of empathy, tolerance and imagination.'

This is something we need to actively promote in the education of our children. Love is natural, hate is taught. So the question is, h

facebook.title: A refugee, like me: why the Golden Rule matters in an era of mass migration
facebook.summary: "The Golden Rule is a moral obligation to treat others well. Understanding the Golden Rule – in whatever form it takes – is one of the important aspects for creating racial tolerance in young people, and society more broadly."
